event.description: Congratulations! The year is 1950, and you have been appointed as the supreme leader of the Republic of Tian.
You are in control of your country - for now. You must establish your government, build your nation and appease the people of Tian if you wish to hold the throne.
Would you like to know more about running your country?
One of your most important responsibilities in Tian is ordering the construction of new buildings.
Try clicking on the BUILD button in the bottom left corner now.

model.description: Use Roads to connect workers to the Lumber Yard.

event.description: The most basic kind of building is a Road. Working class citizens need roads to connect their homes to their places of work.
Buy a Road, and use it to connect your Apartment to your Lumberyard (use WASD or Arrow Keys to scroll the map).

model.description: Use Roads to connect workers to the Lumber Yard.

event.description: Now that you have connected your Lumberyard to your road network, you will need an unemployed citizen to staff it.
Let's reassign a worker. Click on the nearby school to open its menu.

model.description: Use Roads to connect workers to the Lumber Yard.

event.description: Click on the green tab to see this building's workers.

model.description: Use Roads to connect workers to the Lumber Yard.

event.description: Press the 'Fire Worker' button to remove the worker.

model.description: Use Roads to connect workers to the Lumber Yard.

event.description: As you manage the working class, their opinion of you will change. Freedom represents their ability to resist you. Unrest represents their resentment of you.
Keep these stats in check, or risk open rebellion.

model.description: Use Roads to connect workers to the Lumber Yard.

event.description: Lumberyards generate money each year based on how many employees they have.
Click on your Lumberyard to open its menu. Hire your unemployed teacher as a worker to start making money.

model.description: Assign at least one worker to a lumberyard.

event.description: Good work - your economy is now making money!
Financial data is displayed in the top left.

model.description: Assign at least one worker to a lumberyard.

event.description: The final type of building is a residence. New citizens enter Tian each year, and they'll need some place to live.
Open the Build Menu again. Select either an Apartment, Suburb or Mansion and place it on any open tile.

model.description: Build a new residence (Mansion, Suburb or Apartment)

event.description: Good work! Your new residence will be complete in two years.
The most comfortable, well fed and well educated citizens in Tian leave the Working Class and enter the Social Elite. Though they do not work normal jobs, they are still useful to you.

Each Social Elite citizen falls into one of three factions: Financiers, Military Officers, and Bureaucrats. You may choose one Elite to become Minister of their faction, which will unlock new building options.
No one rules alone, and ending a turn with no active Ministers will result in your government dissolving due to lack of staff.
Your active Ministers are displayed on the left side of the screen.
Click on an empty portrait in the Ministry Panel to hire a new Minister.

model.description: Build a new residence (Mansion, Suburb or Apartment)

event.description: Social Elite are listed on the left-hand side of the menu. Click on one of their portraits to bring up their contract and choose to hire them.

model.description: Build a new residence (Mansion, Suburb or Apartment)

event.description: From the Contract Menu, you can configure a minister's paygrade, and make final decisions about hiring or firing them from your ministry.
Click 'Hire' to hire this minister.

model.description: Build a new residence (Mansion, Suburb or Apartment)

event.description: On the right side of the screen, the Stats Panel lists off basic details about your citizens. Click on a piece of data to get more information.

model.description: Build a new residence (Mansion, Suburb or Apartment)

event.description: Congratulations! You now know the basics of how to rule your country. Click the End Turn button in the lower right corner to advance to the next year.
